snippet: In a suburban town near New Haven, the decision brought back painful memories of a crime that began as a home invasion robbery and ended with the deaths of three members of the Petit family in 2007.
abstract: Connecticut Supreme Court's striking down of death penalty law has revived painful memories of Petit family murder in Cheshire and divided those who knew family; murderers Steven Hayes and Joshua Komisarjevsky were set to be executed for crime, in which they killed Jennifer Hawke-Petit and her two daughters in a home invasion.
lead_paragraph: In a suburban town near New Haven, the decision brought back painful memories of a crime that began as a home invasion robbery and ended with the deaths of three members of the Petit family in 2007.

headline.main: Connecticut Death Penalty Ruling Stirs Painful Memories of 3 Grisly Killings
